step.cmd: Click Save script as... at the top of the form/script.
step.stepresult: A Save Query dialog will appear.

step.cmd: Enter a name for the query in the Name field, and choose whether or not to Include current form setup using the check box.
step.stepresult: By default, current form setup is included. This means that search parameters entered in the query form (rather than just the query script) will be saved.

step.cmd: Choose whether to Save in user library, Save in project resources, or Save in another location... and click Save.
step.stepresult: Queries saved in the user library will be accessible in the Query menu for all projects. Queries saved in project resources will be accessible in only the current project's Query menu. Queries saved in other locations will not be available as menu selections.

step.cmd: As you do further work on your script, click Save script (CMD/CTRL+S) to save your work.
